column4: I am trying to upgrade edubuntu 6.06 to 6.10. When I run gksu "update-manager -c" it says "your system is up to date" with no upgrade message available. I have the latest version of Update Manager and have dapper-updates repositories in my sources.list. Is it a bug?
do you have the edgy repositories enabled in sources.list?
I do not have the edgy repositories in my sources.list, according to the upgrade page, I think this is only necessary for the not recommended apt-get method
errml, apt-get/aptitude has always been my "recommended" way and it has always worked right -- dunno what that is all about
